com.tranek.chivalryserverbrowser

Class MainWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tranek.chivalryserverbrowser.MainWindow

  • public class MainWindow
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class that creates the frame and all other components. It also contains useful utility functions used by it and other classes.

        public ChivServer findChivServer(java.lang.String ip,
                        java.lang.String gameport,
                        ServerListInterface sl)
        Returns the ChivServer for the given ip address, gameport, and ServerListInterface.
        Parameters:
        ip - the ip address of the ChivServer
        gameport - the gameport of the ChivServer
        sl - the ServerListInterface that requested the lookup
        Returns:
        the ChivServer if found, null otherwise
        See Also:
        findChivServer(String, String, Vector)

      • addServerTab

        public void addServerTab(java.lang.String ip_port,
                ServerListInterface sl,
                boolean switchToTab)
        Adds a new tab with details about a specific server.
        Parameters:
        ip_port - a string of the "ipaddress:gameport" of the server
        sl - the ServerListInterface that called this method
        switchToTab - whether or not to automatically switch to the new tab
        See Also:
        addServerTab(ChivServer, boolean)

      • addServerTabShownServer

        public void addServerTabShownServer(boolean switchToTab)
        Adds a new tab with details about the server that is currently shown on the map (white marker).
        Parameters:
        switchToTab - whether or not to automatically switch to the new tab
        See Also:
        addServerTab(ChivServer, boolean)

      • addServerTab

        public void addServerTab(java.lang.String ip_port,
                boolean switchToTab)
        Adds a new tab with details about a specific server. It looks up the "ipaddress:gameport" combination from the database of previously seen servers. If the server is not found, it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        ip_port - the "ipaddress:gameport" of the server
        switchToTab - whether or not to automatically switch to the new tab
        See Also:
        addServerTab(ChivServer, boolean)

      • addServerTab

        public void addServerTab(ChivServer cs,
                boolean switchToTab)
        Adds a new tab with details about a specific server.
        Parameters:
        cs - the ChivServer of the new tab
        switchToTab - whether or not to automatically switch to the new tab
        See Also:
        initTabComponent(JTabbedPane, int)

      • addServerTabJS

        public void addServerTabJS(java.lang.String ip_port,
                  java.lang.String sl)
        The method that the map javascript calls to add a new tab with details about a specific server. Since javascript can't send actual java objects, it includes a string parameter representing the server list tab where this server could be found in a lookup.
        Parameters:
        ip_port - the "ipaddress:gameport" of the server
        sl - a string denoting which server list tab that this server originally came from
        See Also:
        addServerTab(ChivServer, boolean), addServerTabShownServer(boolean)

      • joinServer

        public void joinServer(java.lang.String urlstring,
              java.lang.String ip,
              java.lang.String port,
              java.lang.String serverName,
              ServerListInterface sl)
        Launches the game and joins a specific server via the Steam URL.
        Parameters:
        urlstring - the Steam URL to launch the game and join the server
        ip - the ip address of the server
        port - the gameport of the server
        serverName - the name of the server
        sl - the ServerListInterface where this server is found for lookup
        See Also:
        ChivServer, findChivServer(String, String, ServerListInterface), joinServer(String, String, String, String, ChivServer)

      • joinServer

        public void joinServer(java.lang.String urlstring,
              java.lang.String ip,
              java.lang.String port,
              java.lang.String serverName,
              ChivServer cs)
        Launches the game ad joins a specific server via the Steam URL.
        Parameters:
        urlstring - the Steam URL to launch the game and join the server
        ip - the ip address of the server
        port - the gameport of the server
        serverName - the name of the server
        cs - the ChivServer to join
        See Also:

      • joinServer

        public void joinServer(java.lang.String urlstring,
              java.lang.String ip,
              java.lang.String port,
              java.lang.String friendName)
        Launches the game and joins a specific server via the Steam URL that a Steam friend is playing on.
        Parameters:
        urlstring - the Steam URL to launch the game and join the server
        ip - the ip address of the server
        port - the gameport of the server
        friendName - the name of the Steam friend on the server
        See Also:
        Desktop, URI, saveGameConfig(), getLaunchOptions()

      • addServerToDatabase

        public void addServerToDatabase(ChivServer cs)
        Adds a server found during a refresh to the database. If the server already exists, this does nothing.
        Parameters:
        cs - the ChivServer to add to the database
        See Also:
        SQLiteConnection, SQLiteStatement, SQLiteException

      • updateServerDB

        public void updateServerDB()
        Updates the database of servers found during a refresh. These are used for looking up server ip addresses and gameports from the Friends tab to find the queryport to query the server for more information. This method uses servers to update the database.

      • updateServerDB

        public void updateServerDB(java.util.Vector<ChivServer> s)
        Updates the database of servers found during a refresh. These are used for looking up server ip addresses and gameports from the Friends tab to find the queryport to query the server for more information.
        Parameters:
        s - the Vector of ChivServer to update into the database

      • getServerFromDB

        public ChivServer getServerFromDB(java.lang.String ip,
                         java.lang.String gameport)
        Searches the database for a server matching the ip address and gameport to find the associated queryport.
        Parameters:
        ip - the ip address of the server
        gameport - the gameport of the server
        Returns:
        returns the ChivServer; or null if not found
        See Also:
        SQLiteConnection, SQLiteStatement, SQLiteException

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • wrapInBackgroundImage

        public static javax.swing.JPanel wrapInBackgroundImage(javax.swing.JComponent component,
                                       javax.swing.Icon backgroundIcon)
        Wraps a Swing JComponent in a background image. Simply invokes the overloded variant with Top/Leading alignment for background image.
        Parameters:
        component - to wrap in the a background image
        backgroundIcon - the background image (Icon)
        Returns:
        the wrapping JPanel
        See Also:
        "http://www.java-tips.org/java-se-tips/javax.swing/wrap-a-swing-jcomponent-in-a-background-image.html"

      • wrapInBackgroundImage

        public static javax.swing.JPanel wrapInBackgroundImage(javax.swing.JComponent component,
                                       javax.swing.Icon backgroundIcon,
                                       int verticalAlignment,
                                       int horizontalAlignment)
        Wraps a Swing JComponent in a background image. The vertical and horizontal alignment of background image can be specified using the alignment constants from JLabel.
        Parameters:
        component - to wrap in the a background image
        backgroundIcon - the background image (Icon)
        verticalAlignment - vertical alignment. See constants in JLabel.
        horizontalAlignment - horizontal alignment. See constants in JLabel.
        Returns:
        the wrapping JPanel
        See Also:
        "http://www.java-tips.org/java-se-tips/javax.swing/wrap-a-swing-jcomponent-in-a-background-image.html"
